newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Yeltsin getting ready to leave hospital on Friday.
newsitem.headline: Yeltsin getting ready to leave hospital on Friday.

text.p: Russian President Boris Yeltsin, recovering from open heart surgery, will leave hospital for a government rest home on Friday but doctors warned him against taking things too fast.

Interfax news agency quoted Kremlin chief doctor Sergei Mironov as saying that he was afraid Yeltsin could have "overstretched himself" on Wednesday, when he worked, went for a walk in the hospital grounds and was interviewed on television.
"Filming is a serious burden, even for a healthy person, and all the more so for a patient who had a heart operation on November 5," Mironov said.
Yeltsin, 65, said during the interview that he was in fighting mood after quintuple bypass operation and would return to work after a spell in the Barvikha sanatorium.
He walked slowly and stiffly, but spoke in a firm voice and there was colour in his cheeks. It was his first public appearance since well before the operation.
The presidential press service said Yeltsin would probably spend two or three weeks at Barvikha, but he could return to work in the Kremlin by the end of the year.
The spokesman said the president was feeling well and his recovery was in line with doctors' expectations.
Mironov said Yeltsin was getting ready for his move to Barvikha, a complex including a sanatorium and government residences just outside Moscow.
